attributes.action: Establish Palestinian rights in Israel so they are no longer 2nd grade citizens
attributes.additional_details: The British government owe it to the Palestinian people after their involvement in carving out Israel in the Balfour agreement. Since then the Palestinian people have been actively evicted and pushed out of their homes. This must end - the UK government needs to take active steps to restore Palestinian rights so that they can have normal lives in the country they call home.
attributes.background: Take active steps to ensure the Palestinian people are protected against violence, forcible evictions and have the same rights as their Israeli counterparts to live their lives without fear of violence or limitations.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the current situation in the Middle East, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Condemn Israel for their treatment of Palestine and Palestinians: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585309

Introduce sanctions against Israel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585314

UK Government to formally recognise the State of Palestine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585313
